acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The magazines are arranged in one box in chronological order.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: BQE Magazine, later known as The Brooklyn Queens Monthly, was a periodical published by BQE Magazine, Inc. The magazine was advertised as an alternative news source for Brooklyn and Queens residents whose interests lay outside the mainstream culture associated with Manhattan. Articles and features related to fashion, arts and culture, dining, nightlife, and politics. Profiles of various Brooklyn and Queens neighborhoods were also included.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); BQE Magazine collection, ARC.180, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2025.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains several monthly issues of BQE Magazine from the years 1988 and 1989, occurring in chronological order and housed in one box. 1988 issues are from January, May, July/August, October, and November, while 1989 issues are from February, March, July/August, September, and October. Issues dating from July/August 1989 forward feature the title The Brooklyn Queens Monthly on their cover pages.
